value:
{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.05837v1", "title": "Derivation of Kirchhoff-type plate theories for elastic materials with
  voids", "summary": "We rigorously derive a Blake-Zisserman-Kirchhoff theory for thin plates with
material voids, starting from a three-dimensional model with elastic bulk and
interfacial energy featuring a Willmore-type curvature penalization. The
effective two-dimensional model comprises a classical elastic bending energy
and surface terms which reflect the possibility that voids can persist in the
limit, that the limiting plate can be broken apart into several pieces, or that
the plate can be folded. Building upon and extending the techniques used in the
authors' recent work on the derivation of one-dimensional theories for thin
brittle rods with voids, the present contribution generalizes the results of
Santili and Schmidt (2022), by considering general geometries on the admissible
set of voids and constructing recovery sequences for all admissible limiting
configurations.", "main_category": "math.AP", "categories": "math.AP", "published": "2025-04-08T09:19:37Z"}
